Confirming Tigerbubble's Findings On Battle Sense Loss
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Confirming Tigerbubble's Findings On Battle Sense Loss
By Lisa Shock on Monday, February 17, 2003 - 11:17 pm:

Just like TB's post in the Battle Sense thread, I too just had a monster get to C level, venture 4 weeks and get C-level points at noisy halls (I am DMMing), then mysteriously had it drop back down to D. It's not a problem with a bad save, I still have all the items from the ventures, and the levels of my techs are still raised as they were (and yes, I actually saw the level say "C" on several occasions!) prior to the lowering. Arrgh!

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, February 18, 2003 - 06:56 pm:

Well, I entered another venture battle and it's back up to C now.

By torey luvullo on Wednesday, February 19, 2003 - 05:17 am:

i have experienced battle sense slippage if i go an undefined period without battling. i have a feeling, unproven, that the more solidly you achieve your level, the longer it takes without battling to experience this slippage.

By Deadbuffalo on Wednesday, February 19, 2003 - 12:39 pm:

I had "slippage" today while finishing my gitan. A to B. I had been watching for it about every 2 months, and entered a battle as soon as I could. Back up to A. No clue about how to become "entrenched" in A battle sense, but I'm guessing torey is on the right lines of it if by "more solidly achieve your level" he means you fight more battles even after achieving A-level sense.
